attributes.action: review the tight rules on third party sponsor support for settlement visas and take a close look at the heartache that alot of us uk citizens married to non-eu citizens are being put through time and time again
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: an example is: visa is refused despite having £4000 in joint bank,being together for 5 years,plus all the evidence supplied when applying.There are many people that leave UK + live with their spouse as visa waiting time is ridiculous + at the end of it you get refused because you have no'base,job or house'of your own in uk'(could be because you were living with spouse abroad maybe?)3rd party income not great but support available:accomodation,financial etc.Do we all have to be rich just to live our lives with the one we love?3rd party support in writing is signed sealed+delivered to the desired embassy at which the spouse is applying,then ignored.husbands+wives can work as soon as they arrive to the uk,why do we need so much savings?why is it that just because my example+many others are non-eu citizens,they must be subjected to horrible degrading interviews+appeals when all they want to do is be happy with the one they love not just on the telephone but in person+have a family together?Non-eu citizens have a right to marriage+love just like eu citizens,after all we are only human,no-matter where we are from,where are the human rights in that?
